RHETORIC.Definition: speech or writing intended to be effective and influence people

PROPAGANDA.Definition: information, ideas, opinions, or images, often only giving one part of an argument, that are broadcast, published, or in some other way spread with the intention of influencing people's opinions

ADVANCE.Definition: to go or move something forward, or to develop or improve something

SET OUT.Definition: to give the details of or explain something, esp. in writing

CONCISE.Definition: short and clear, expressing what needs to be said without unnecessary words

ARTICULATE.Definition: able to express thoughts and feelings easily and clearly, or showing this quality

METAPHOR.Definition: an expression, often found in literature, that describes a person or object by referring to something that is considered to have similar characteristics to that person or object

SIMILE.Definition: (the use of) an expression comparing one thing with another, always including the words "as" or "like"

JARGON.Definition: special words and phrases that are used by particular groups of people, especially in their work

BARBAROUS.Definition: extremely cruel or unpleasant, or failing to reach acceptable social standards

SHOW OFF.Definition: to behave in a way that is intended to attract attention or admiration, and that other people often find annoying

EXTENSIVE.Definition: covering a large area ; having a great range

EVALUATED.Definition: to judge or calculate the quality, importance, amount, or value of something

MERITS.Definition: the quality of being good and deserving praise

IMPLIES.Definition: to communicate an idea or feeling without saying it directly

FORCEFUL.Definition: expressing opinions strongly and demanding attention or action

TEMPTATION.Definition: something that makes you want to do or have something that you know you should not

RECAP.Definition: to repeat the main points of an explanation or description

SMILING DOWN ON YOU.Definition: this implies that someone who is dead will be happy or glad with your actions
